alert.note: Alert for Edgecombe (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 10:09AM EST until January 18 at 9:24PM EST by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Tar River At Tarboro affecting Edgecombe County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tar River at Tarboro. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, The river is at bankfull. At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. The Riverside Park and River Road at the US64 bridge flood. At 20.0 feet, Lowland flooding begins south of Daniel Street in east Tarboro. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 21.9 feet. - Bankfull stage is 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is cresting this morning and will begin falling below flood stage late tomorrow morning and continue falling to 7.7 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 22.2 feet on 04/02/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Tar River Tarboro 19.0 21.9 Wed 9 am EST 18.1 13.2 10.4 8.6 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
